head.supplied: Paris, 9 November 1895. ¶ Dear Sir, ¶ ¶ The Administration of the Museum has received several cases containing numerous collection objects that you have been kind enough to offer to it; my attention ...

div.p: Archives Nationales, Paris, MS AJ/15/65, f. 236.

Letter not found. The text is taken from a letter-copy book kept by the Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris.
Paris, le 9 Novembre 1895.

L’Administration du Muséum a reçu plusieurs caisses contenant de nombreux objets de collections que vous avez bien voulu lui offrir; on me signale notamment votre magnifique envoi d’Insectes australiens (Hyménoptères, orthoptères et hémiptères) dont plusieurs espèces n’étaient pas représentées dans nos Galeries.
J’ai l’honneur de vous adresser mes vifs remerciements pour les témoignages continus de l’intérêt que vous portez au développement de nos collections.
Veuillez croire, Cher Monsieur, à l’expression de mes sentiments très dévoués.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Sir Ferdinand Von Müller, Director of the botanic Garden Melbourne — Victoria (Australia)

The Administration of the Museum has received several cases containing numerous collection objects that you have been kind enough to offer to it; my attention has been drawn in particular to the magnificent sending of Australian Insects (Hymenoptera, orthoptera and hemiptera), several species of which were not represented in our galleries.
M planned to send boxes of specimens to the Museum in 1895; in M to A. Milne-Edwards, 30 April 1895 he wrote 'I will endeavour to send something to you by every voyage of the "Australien", though it is often difficult to secure rarities'. M to A. Milne-Edwards, 11 November 1895 (in this edition as 95-11-26a) Is the next surviving letter to Milne-Edwards, and it is not known when the specimens of the groups mentioned in the letter were sent.
I have the honour of expressing to you my lively thanks for the continued evidence of the interest you take in the development of our collections.
Believe me to be, Dear Sir,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p: Sir Ferdinand Von Müller, Director of the Botanic Garden, Melbourne, Victoria (Australia)
